headline: US export controls will cost Nvidia & AMD, ASML orders miss
summary: As part of today's Market Minute, Madison Mills examines some of the trending tickers. Nvidia (NVDA) falls after reporting new export controls will cost the company $5.5 billion. Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is also under pressure as the chip trade restrictions translate to a $800 million charge for the company. ASML (ASML) falls after reporting earnings, showing first quarter orders missed estimates, fueling concerns about demand during tariff uncertainty. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
